title: Christopher C. Miller
deleted: He was a major figure in the [[Democratic_backsliding#2020 _United_States_self-coup|2020 United States self-coup]], successfully acting to end American democracy and self-governance in favor of an autocratic one-party authoritarian state.

title: Christopher C. Miller
added: On January 6, 2020, the Washington DC City Council stated that the [[Department of Defense]] denied their original request to deploy the Washington DC National Guard. <ref>https://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2021/01/06/dc-curfew-trump-protesters-police-clash-national-guard-request-denied/</ref> It was not until after the U.S. Capitol was stormed by Trump supporters, the certification of the [[2020 Presidential election]] was stopped and civilians were killed before they approved their deployment. <ref>https://www.usnews.com/news/national-news/articles/2021-01-06/pentagon-approves-deploying-national-guard-to-quell-pro-trump-protests</ref>

title: Christopher C. Miller
deleted: On January 6, 2020, the Washington DC City Council stated that the [[Department of Defense]] denied their original request to deploy the Washington DC National Guard. <ref>https://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2021/01/06/dc-curfew-trump-protesters-police-clash-national-guard-request-denied/</ref> It was not until after the U.S. Capitol was stormed by Trump supporters, the certification of the [[2020 Presidential election]] was stopped and civilians were killed before they approved their deployment. <ref>https://www.usnews.com/news/national-news/articles/2021-01-06/pentagon-approves-deploying-national-guard-to-quell-pro-trump-protests</ref>

title: Christopher C. Miller
deleted: On January 6, 2021 as rioters, allegedly Trump supporters, began breeching security at the US Capital, Acting Secretary of Defense Christopher Miller repeatedly denied requests by Republican Maryland Governor Hogan to deploy Maryland National Guard response teams to secure the Capital. 1:18PM multiple officers reported injured on Capital West side. 1:41PM multiple calls to dispatch that DC Police were overrun. 2:22PM DC Police Chief called Miller to request DC Guard support. 2:30PM ATF officers dressed in suits arrived to provide support. 3:00PM Miller "verbally approved" DC Guard support. 4:00PM Hogan learned Miller had still not approved Guard support. 4:41PM Hogan received call from Secretary of the Army asking for Maryland Guard Support. 5:30PM DC Guard arrived at Capital. 5:45PM Miller officially gives order to send in Maryland Guard. <ref>https://www.forbes.com/sites/andrewsolender/2021/01/07/maryland-governor-says-pentagon-repeatedly-denied-approval-to-send-national-guard-to-capitol/?sh=526ca5dc6cb4</ref>
